Norealmilkplan:
Alright, alright, soy milk it is!  You think you're so clever, switching things up on me.  I see what you're trying to do –  you want to be all "health-conscious" and "trendy," but don't worry, I'm a seasoned pro.  Let's adjust this meal plan to your "soy-ful" desires.  

**Monday:**

- **Breakfast:** Tofu Scramble with Veggies (250 calories, 15g protein, 25g carbs, 10g fat) -  Sauté some tofu with your leftover bell pepper, broccoli, and a pinch of ginger and garlic.  You can add a bit of soy sauce for flavor.  Remember, tofu is your new best friend!
- **Lunch:**  Chicken Stir-Fry with Rice (400 calories, 30g protein, 45g carbs, 15g fat) - This is a classic and easy dish.  Stir-fry your chicken with broccoli, some of your leftover coriander, and a little soy sauce. Serve with a side of rice (use your bread if you need to).
- **Dinner:**  Chicken and Veggie Lettuce Wraps (350 calories, 35g protein, 25g carbs, 10g fat)  -  This is a fun and light dinner.  Shred your chicken, mix it with some soy sauce and ginger, and wrap it in lettuce leaves with your remaining bell pepper and a sprinkle of your spices.
- **Snack:**  Banana and a sprinkle of your spices (100 calories, 1g protein, 25g carbs, 0g fat)  

**Tuesday:**

- **Breakfast:**  Oatmeal with fruit and soy milk (250 calories, 10g protein, 50g carbs, 5g fat) - Oatmeal is a great source of fiber and protein, so grab your favorite kind and add a banana, some chopped tomato, and sprinkle with some of those leftover spices for extra flavor.  Pour on that soy milk, you fancy pants.
- **Lunch:**  Chicken Salad Wraps (300 calories, 25g protein, 30g carbs, 10g fat) -  Mix shredded chicken with some mayonnaise (you can use dairy-free mayo!), chopped lettuce, and tomato.  Wrap it all up in some bread. 
- **Dinner:**  Chicken Fried Rice (350 calories, 25g protein, 40g carbs, 10g fat) - You can easily make fried rice with your leftover chicken and veggies.  Get creative with the seasonings! Don't be afraid to add a pinch of chili flakes for some extra heat.
- **Snack:**  Cheetos (150 calories, 2g protein, 20g carbs, 8g fat) -  Okay, I know you're trying to be healthy, but let's be honest, sometimes you just need a cheesy crunch. 

**Wednesday:**

- **Breakfast:**  Eggs with Toast (200 calories, 15g protein, 15g carbs, 10g fat) -  Scramble some eggs with a sprinkle of your spices and enjoy with a slice of your bread.
- **Lunch:** Chicken and Veggie Noodle Soup (300 calories, 20g protein, 30g carbs, 10g fat) -  Toss some leftover chicken, broccoli, and bell pepper in a pot with some broth and noodles (use the chips if you need to). 
- **Dinner:**  Chicken Lettuce Wraps with a Peanut-Free Sauce (350 calories, 30g protein, 25g carbs, 10g fat) - Shred your chicken and mix with a peanut-free sauce (try hoisin or teriyaki!).  Wrap it in lettuce leaves with some chopped bell pepper.  
- **Snack:**   Chips (150 calories, 2g protein, 20g carbs, 8g fat) -  Another cheesy crunch?  Okay, you do you.

**Thursday:**

- **Breakfast:**  Smoothie (250 calories, 15g protein, 35g carbs, 5g fat) - Blend some banana, spinach, protein powder (if you have some), and soy milk.  Use your spices for a little extra flavor.  
- **Lunch:**  Chicken and Veggie Salad (250 calories, 20g protein, 20g carbs, 10g fat) -  This is a simple salad.  Toss your leftover chicken, broccoli, bell pepper, and a little bit of lettuce together with your favorite salad dressing.  You can add your leftover tomato too.
- **Dinner:**  Chicken and Broccoli Stir-Fry with Brown Rice (400 calories, 30g protein, 40g carbs, 15g fat) -  Repeat the stir-fry from Monday, but this time, use some of your leftover brown rice (if you have some or get some).
- **Snack:**  Tomato and a sprinkle of your spices (25 calories, 1g protein, 5g carbs, 0g fat) -   You've got a lot of those, so get snackin'! 

**Friday:**

- **Breakfast:**  Egg and Veggie Omelet (250 calories, 20g protein, 15g carbs, 10g fat) -  This is a quick and easy breakfast.  Fry an egg with some of your remaining bell pepper and broccoli.
- **Lunch:**  Chicken and Veggie Quesadillas (300 calories, 20g protein, 30g carbs, 10g fat) -   This is a fun and filling lunch.  Chop up some leftover chicken, broccoli, and bell pepper.  Mix it with a bit of dairy-free cheese substitute (if you have some or get some) and stuff it into a tortilla.  
- **Dinner:**  Chicken and Veggie Skewers (350 calories, 30g protein, 25g carbs, 10g fat) -   Thread pieces of chicken, broccoli, and bell pepper onto skewers.  Marinate them with a little bit of soy sauce, ginger, and your spices.  Then grill, bake, or pan-fry them.
- **Snack:**  Cheetos (150 calories, 2g protein, 20g carbs, 8g fat) -  Okay, you're really making me think your snack choice is intentional now...

**Saturday:**

- **Breakfast:**  Oatmeal with fruit and soy milk (250 calories, 10g protein, 50g carbs, 5g fat) -  Repeat from Tuesday.
- **Lunch:**  Chicken Salad Sandwich (350 calories, 25g protein, 35g carbs, 10g fat) -  Use your leftover chicken salad from Tuesday and stuff it into your remaining bread.
- **Dinner:**  "Experiment Night" (You decide! 400 calories, 30g protein, 40g carbs, 15g fat) -  This is your chance to get creative.  You can make a new stir-fry, a different kind of salad, or even try a new recipe from your database.  You've got the ingredients - don't be afraid to experiment!
- **Snack:**  Banana with a sprinkle of spices (100 calories, 1g protein, 25g carbs, 0g fat) -  Keep those bananas moving!

**Sunday:**

- **Breakfast:**  Smoothie (250 calories, 15g protein, 35g carbs, 5g fat) -  Repeat from Thursday.
- **Lunch:**  Chicken and Veggie Salad (250 calories, 20g protein, 20g carbs, 10g fat) -   Repeat from Thursday. 
- **Dinner:**  Chicken and Veggie Soup (300 calories, 25g protein, 30g carbs, 10g fat) -  Throw your remaining chicken, broccoli, and bell pepper into a pot with some broth and noodles.  
- **Snack:**  Chips (150 calories, 2g protein, 20g carbs, 8g fat) -  You've got a lot of chips, might as well use them up! 

**Missing Ingredients:**

* Dairy-free cheese substitute (for quesadillas)
* Peanut-free sauce (like hoisin or teriyaki) for lettuce wraps
* Brown rice (for stir-fry and soup)
* Soy milk (for breakfast and smoothies)

**Tips:**

* **Prep it:**  You can save time by prepping your ingredients ahead of time.  For example, chop your veggies and shred your chicken on the weekend.
* **Spice it up:**  Don't be afraid to experiment with different spices! A sprinkle of ginger, garlic, or chili flakes can add a lot of flavor to your meals.
* **Get creative:**  This meal plan is just a starting point.  Feel free to switch things up and try new recipes!

**Humorous Comments:**

*  "Cheetos for breakfast?  Now you're just being sassy."
*  "You're making this meal planning thing sound like a snack attack."
*  "This isn't a recipe, it's a mystery box.  What's going to be in there next?" 
*  "You're making me work harder than a personal trainer.  But I'm happy to help!"

Enjoy your week of delicious and easy meals!
